questions.hint: On utilise $\cos(3x) = \cos(2x + x) = \cos(2x)\cos(x) - \sin(2x)\sin(x)$.\par\parAvec $\cos(2x) = 2\cos^2(x) - 1$ et $\sin(2x) = 2\sin(x)\cos(x)$ :\par$$\cos(3x) = (2\cos^2 x - 1)\cos x - 2\sin x \cos x \cdot \sin x$$\par$$= 2\cos^3 x - \cos x - 2\sin^2 x \cos x$$\par$$= 2\cos^3 x - \cos x - 2(1-\cos^2 x)\cos x$$\par$$= 2\cos^3 x - \cos x - 2\cos x + 2\cos^3 x$$\par$$= \boxed{4\cos^3 x - 3\cos x}$$

On utilise $\sin(3x) = \sin(2x + x) = \sin(2x)\cos(x) + \cos(2x)\sin(x)$.\par\parAvec $\sin(2x) = 2\sin x \cos x$ et $\cos(2x) = 1 - 2\sin^2 x$ :\par$$\sin(3x) = 2\sin x \cos x \cdot \cos x + (1 - 2\sin^2 x)\sin x$$\par$$= 2\sin x \cos^2 x + \sin x - 2\sin^3 x$$\par$$= 2\sin x (1 - \sin^2 x) + \sin x - 2\sin^3 x$$\par$$= 2\sin x - 2\sin^3 x + \sin x - 2\sin^3 x$$\par$$= \boxed{3\sin x - 4\sin^3 x}$$

On a $\tan(3x) = \frac{\sin(3x)}{\cos(3x)}$. Divisons numérateur et dénominateur par $\cos^3 x$ :\par\par$$\tan(3x) = \frac{3\sin x - 4\sin^3 x}{4\cos^3 x - 3\cos x} = \frac{\frac{3\sin x}{\cos^3 x} - \frac{4\sin^3 x}{\cos^3 x}}{\frac{4\cos^3 x}{\cos^3 x} - \frac{3\cos x}{\cos^3 x}}$$\par\par$$= \frac{\frac{3\tan x}{\cos^2 x} - 4\tan^3 x}{4 - \frac{3}{\cos^2 x}}$$\par\parEn utilisant $\frac{1}{\cos^2 x} = 1 + \tan^2 x$ :\par$$= \frac{3\tan x(1 + \tan^2 x) - 4\tan^3 x}{4 - 3(1 + \tan^2 x)}$$\par$$= \frac{3\tan x + 3\tan^3 x - 4\tan^3 x}{4 - 3 - 3\tan^2 x} = \boxed{\frac{3\tan x - \tan^3 x}{1 - 3\tan^2 x}}$$
